head.title: SPRINTERS COMMIT TO NEW YORK MEET

hedline.hl1: SPRINTERS COMMIT TO NEW YORK MEET

block.p: Three sprinters from the United States -- Tyson Gay, Wallace Spearmon Jr. and Lauryn Williams -- and one from Jamaica -- Veronica Campbell -- are the first elite athletes named to compete in track and field's Reebok Grand Prix June 2 at Icahn Stadium on Randalls Island.

Three sprinters from the United States -- Tyson Gay, Wallace Spearmon Jr. and Lauryn Williams -- and one from Jamaica -- Veronica Campbell -- are the first elite athletes named to compete in track and field's Reebok Grand Prix June 2 at Icahn Stadium on Randalls Island.

Williams and Campbell will run in the women's 100 meters, Gay in the men's 100 and Spearmon in the men's 200. The meet is one of two internationally ranked Grand Prix competitions in the United States, preceding the Prefontaine Classic June 10 in Eugene, Ore.
